intro: Mesembryanthemum fulleri, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces vibrant yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fleshy, water-storing leaves help it survive in arid environments, making it well adapted to dry conditions. Mesembryanthemum fulleri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
